intro: Crawfurdia tripterospermum, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a fleshy, red or purple fruit that contains numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
